Información sobre el uso
Información sobre el usode su tarjeta EBTFamilies Firstwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com1-800-997-3333Families FirstElectronicBenefitsTransfer(Transferencia Electrónica deBeneficios)¿Cómo puedo proteger mitarjeta EBT y mi PIN?u Nunca revele a nadie su PIN.u No escriba el PIN en latarjeta o portatarjetas.Tampoco lleve el númerocon usted en su cartera o billetera, donde alguienpodría encontrarlo.u Si no puede encontrar su tarjeta o si piensa quealguien más sabe su PIN, llame al Servicio deatención al cliente de inmediato al 1-800-997-3333.u Mantenga su tarjeta alejada de equipos electrónicos(como la televisión y horno microondas), imanes yel sol.Recuerde, si alguien utiliza su tarjeta yPIN y utiliza sus beneficios, estos no sereemplazarán.¿Qué sucede si olvida su PIN?Si olvida su PIN pero no perdió su tarjeta, puedecambiar su PIN en línea en www.NJFamiliesFirst.com después de crear una cuenta de usuario y deiniciar sesión. O puede llamar al Servicio de atenciónal cliente al 1-800-997-3333 o visitar su Agencia deBienestar del Condado (CWA, por sus siglas en inglés).Tarjetas perdidas, robadas o dañadasSi su tarjeta se pierde o es robada, esimportante reportarla de inmediato en línea enwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com o llamando al Servicio deatención al cliente al 1-800-997-3333. Esto “congelará”su tarjeta para que nadie utilice sus beneficios. Despuésde reportarla, vaya a su CWA local para obtener unatarjeta de reemplazo. Puede recibir hasta dos tarjetasde reemplazo sin cargo. Luego de haber recibido dostarjetas, se le cobrará un cargo de reemplazo de $2.00por cada tarjeta adicional.¿Cuándo recibo los beneficios?u Recibirá los beneficios el mismo día cada mes.u Si se cierra su caso y tiene beneficios en su tarjetaFamilies First, usted puede utilizar esos beneficioshasta gastarlos.u Si no utiliza ninguno de sus beneficios en efectivodurante tres meses, se cerrará su caso y no podráutilizar los beneficios en efectivo restantes.u Si no utiliza ninguno de sus beneficios de alimentosen su tarjeta durante seis meses, se suspenderásu caso y no podrá utilizar los beneficios restantes.Deberá comunicarse con su CWA local paraaveriguar si es elegible para utilizar los beneficiosde alimentos restantes.u Si recibe el saldo de su cuenta y el monto esdiferente al que espera, comuníquese con su CWAlocal.Es ilegal.Las tarjetas Families First no pueden utilizarse paraacceder a beneficios en efectivo en las siguientesubicaciones:u Licorerías;u Casinos/establecimientos de juego; yu Establecimientos minoristas que brindanentretenimiento para adultos, como clubes destriptease.¡Vender su tarjeta o PIN a otras personas es un delito!Si se determina que ha cometido una violación, se lesancionará y:u deberá pagar cualquier beneficio que se hayaobtenido ilegalmente.u será descalificado del programa.u será remitido para enjuiciamiento penal.Producido por la Oficina de Publicaciones del DHS 12/17Esta institución es un proveedor que ofrece igualdad deoportunidades.Departamento de Servicios Humanos de New JerseyDivisión de Desarrollo FamiliarNJSPBR04 12/17
Información sobre el usode su tarjeta EBTFamilies Firstwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com1-800-997-3333Families FirstElectronicBenefitsTransfer(Transferencia Electrónica deBeneficios)¿Cómo puedo proteger mitarjeta EBT y mi PIN?u Nunca revele a nadie su PIN.u No escriba el PIN en latarjeta o portatarjetas.Tampoco lleve el númerocon usted en su cartera o billetera, donde alguienpodría encontrarlo.u Si no puede encontrar su tarjeta o si piensa quealguien más sabe su PIN, llame al Servicio deatención al cliente de inmediato al 1-800-997-3333.u Mantenga su tarjeta alejada de equipos electrónicos(como la televisión y horno microondas), imanes yel sol.Recuerde, si alguien utiliza su tarjeta yPIN y utiliza sus beneficios, estos no sereemplazarán.¿Qué sucede si olvida su PIN?Si olvida su PIN pero no perdió su tarjeta, puedecambiar su PIN en línea en www.NJFamiliesFirst.com después de crear una cuenta de usuario y deiniciar sesión. O puede llamar al Servicio de atenciónal cliente al 1-800-997-3333 o visitar su Agencia deBienestar del Condado (CWA, por sus siglas en inglés).Tarjetas perdidas, robadas o dañadasSi su tarjeta se pierde o es robada, esimportante reportarla de inmediato en línea enwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com o llamando al Servicio deatención al cliente al 1-800-997-3333. Esto “congelará”su tarjeta para que nadie utilice sus beneficios. Despuésde reportarla, vaya a su CWA local para obtener unatarjeta de reemplazo. Puede recibir hasta dos tarjetasde reemplazo sin cargo. Luego de haber recibido dostarjetas, se le cobrará un cargo de reemplazo de $2.00por cada tarjeta adicional.¿Cuándo recibo los beneficios?u Recibirá los beneficios el mismo día cada mes.u Si se cierra su caso y tiene beneficios en su tarjetaFamilies First, usted puede utilizar esos beneficioshasta gastarlos.u Si no utiliza ninguno de sus beneficios en efectivodurante tres meses, se cerrará su caso y no podráutilizar los beneficios en efectivo restantes.u Si no utiliza ninguno de sus beneficios de alimentosen su tarjeta durante seis meses, se suspenderásu caso y no podrá utilizar los beneficios restantes.Deberá comunicarse con su CWA local paraaveriguar si es elegible para utilizar los beneficiosde alimentos restantes.u Si recibe el saldo de su cuenta y el monto esdiferente al que espera, comuníquese con su CWAlocal.Es ilegal.Las tarjetas Families First no pueden utilizarse paraacceder a beneficios en efectivo en las siguientesubicaciones:u Licorerías;u Casinos/establecimientos de juego; yu Establecimientos minoristas que brindanentretenimiento para adultos, como clubes destriptease.¡Vender su tarjeta o PIN a otras personas es un delito!Si se determina que ha cometido una violación, se lesancionará y:u deberá pagar cualquier beneficio que se hayaobtenido ilegalmente.u será descalificado del programa.u será remitido para enjuiciamiento penal.Producido por la Oficina de Publicaciones del DHS 12/17Esta institución es un proveedor que ofrece igualdad deoportunidades.Departamento de Servicios Humanos de New JerseyDivisión de Desarrollo FamiliarNJSPBR04 12/17¿Cómo puedo utilizar mi tarjeta en la tienda decomestibles?u Puede usar la tarjeta en la tienda de comestiblespara utilizar sus beneficios NJ SNAP.u Puede usar la tarjeta en la tienda de comestiblespara utilizar sus beneficios en efectivo en artículosque no pueden pagarse con NJ SNAP.u En algunas tiendas, puede usar su tarjeta pararetirar sus beneficios en efectivo.u Antes de realizar las compras, asegúrese de quela tienda acepte la tarjeta; busque el logotipo deQuest ® en las ventanas o en las puertas. Si no veel logotipo de Quest ®diríjase al mostradorde atención al cliente ypregunte si la tienda aceptala tarjeta Families First.u Dígale al empleado que desea usar su tarjeta.u Deslice su tarjeta por la máquina.u Elija ALIMENTOS o EFECTIVO.u Ingrese su PIN en el teclado.RECUERDE: Guarde su recibo para conocersu saldo la próxima vez que vaya a realizarcompras.¿Qué pasa si la máquina de EBT de la tiendano funciona?Usted podrá utilizar su tarjeta incluso si las máquinasde EBT de la tienda no funcionan. El cajero de la tiendapuede usar un comprobante de papel y llamar pararecibir aprobación telefónica por su compra.¿Cómo puedo utilizar mi tarjeta en el cajeroautomático (ATM)?Si recibe beneficios en efectivo del programa de bienestarWork First New Jersey (Primero el Trabajo en NewJersey), usted puede obtener efectivo y verificar su saldoen un cajero automático. Busque el logotipo Quest ®. Sive el logotipo Quest ®, puede utilizar su tarjeta en esamáquina. Estas son las instrucciones para hacerlo:Siga las instrucciones del cajero automático paraescanear o ingresar su tarjeta.u Ingrese su PIN.u Elija la opción Retiro en efectivo o Consulta desaldo. (No puede consultar el saldo de NJ SNAPen un cajero automático.)u Seleccione la opción VERIFICAR.u Si se aprueba su transacción, el cajero automáticole dará su dinero en efectivo e imprimirá un reciboal finalizar la transacción.u Guarde su recibo y no olvide llevarse la tarjeta y elefectivo.Usted tendrá tres retiros de efectivo gratis por mes.Cada retiro adicional de efectivo tiene un costode 40¢. Esta tarifa se deducirá de su cuenta enefectivo. No hay cargos por consultas de saldo enun cajero automático.¿Cómo puedo averiguar cuánto dinero está enmi NJ SNAP y mi cuentas de efectivo?1. Vaya a www.NJFamiliesFirst.com, ahí puede ver elsaldo actual de su tarjeta y el historial de transacciones,así como denunciar la pérdida o robo de tarjetas y vermateriales del programa.2. Llame al Servicio de atención al cliente al 1-800-997-3333, ahí puede utilizar el sistema de teléfonoautomático para obtener su saldo.3. Vaya a un cajero automático para solicitar unaverificación de saldo (no todos los cajeros automáticosproporcionan saldos de cuentas) o verifique su últimorecibo. No puede obtener el saldo de NJ SNAP en uncajero automático, solo el saldo de efectivo.Está en el camino de disfrutar una forma fácil ysegura de obtener sus beneficios en efectivo y NJSNAP, anteriormente conocidos como Bonos paraalimentos.¿Qué es EBT?EBT, que significa Transferencia Electrónica deBeneficios, es un proceso que le permite utilizar sutarjeta Families First para obtener beneficios que sedepositan en una cuenta. Su tarjeta es similar a unatarjeta bancaria y está protegida con un Número deIdentificación Personal (PIN).¡No eche su tarjeta a la basura!No recibirá una tarjeta nueva cada mes.¡Bienvenido al ProgramaEBT de New Jersey!Si usted recibe asistencia de cuidado infantil,comuníquese con la agencia de Envíos y Recursos deCuidado Infantil (CCR&R) para que su tarjeta FamiliesFirst (que se usa para TANF o NJ SNAP) también puedausarse para los servicios de cuidado infantil. Si norecibe asistencia de cuidado infantil, no es necesariollamar a la CCR&R.
Information on using your
Information on using yourFamilies FirstEBT cardwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com1-800-997-3333Families FirstElectronicBenefitsTransferHow do I protect my EBTcard and PIN?u Never tell anyone your PIN.u Do not write your PIN onyour card or card holder.Also, do not carry thenumber with you in your purse or wallet, wheresomeone could find it.u If you cannot find your card or if you think thatsomeone else knows your PIN, call CustomerService immediately at 1-800-997-3333.u Keep your card away from electronic equipment(like TVs and microwaves) and magnets and out ofthe sun.Remember, if someone else uses your cardand PIN and they use your benefits, yourbenefits will not be replaced.What to do if you forgot your PIN?If you forget your PIN but haven’t lost your card, you canchange your PIN online at www.NJFamiliesFirst.comafter you create a user account and log in. Or you cancall Customer Service at 1-800-997-3333 or visit yourlocal County Welfare Agency (CWA).Lost, Stolen or Damaged CardsIf your card has been lost, stolen or damaged, itis important to immediately report it online atwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com or by calling CustomerService at 1-800-997-3333. This will “freeze” your cardso no one can use your benefits. After reporting it, go toyour local CWA in order to get a replacement card. Youmay receive up to two replacement cards at no charge.After you have received two cards, you will be charged areplacement fee of $2.00 for each additional card.When do I receive my benefits?u You will receive your benefits on the same dayevery month.u If your case closes and you have benefits on yourFamilies First card, you can still use those benefitsuntil they are gone.u If you do not use any of your cash benefits for threemonths, your case will be closed and you will not beable to use the remaining cash benefits.u If you do not use any food benefits on your card forsix months, your case will be suspended and youwill not be able to use the remaining benefits. Youwill have to contact your local CWA to see if you areeligible for the remaining food benefits.u If you receive your account balance(s) and theamount is different than you expect, contact yourlocal CWA.It’s Illegal.Families First cards may not be used to accesscash benefits from the following locations:u Liquor Stores;u Casinos/gaming establishments; andu Retail establishments providing adult entertainment,such as strip clubs.It is a crime to sell your card and PIN to others!If a violation is determined, you will be sanctioned and:u you will have to pay back any benefits that wereobtained illegally.u you will be disqualified from the program.u you will be referred for criminal prosecution.Produced by DHS Office of Publications 12/17This institution is an equal opportunity provider.New Jersey Department of Human ServicesDivision of Family DevelopmentNJENBR04 12/17
Information on using yourFamilies FirstEBT cardwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com1-800-997-3333Families FirstElectronicBenefitsTransferHow do I protect my EBTcard and PIN?u Never tell anyone your PIN.u Do not write your PIN onyour card or card holder.Also, do not carry thenumber with you in your purse or wallet, wheresomeone could find it.u If you cannot find your card or if you think thatsomeone else knows your PIN, call CustomerService immediately at 1-800-997-3333.u Keep your card away from electronic equipment(like TVs and microwaves) and magnets and out ofthe sun.Remember, if someone else uses your cardand PIN and they use your benefits, yourbenefits will not be replaced.What to do if you forgot your PIN?If you forget your PIN but haven’t lost your card, you canchange your PIN online at www.NJFamiliesFirst.comafter you create a user account and log in. Or you cancall Customer Service at 1-800-997-3333 or visit yourlocal County Welfare Agency (CWA).Lost, Stolen or Damaged CardsIf your card has been lost, stolen or damaged, itis important to immediately report it online atwww.NJFamiliesFirst.com or by calling CustomerService at 1-800-997-3333. This will “freeze” your cardso no one can use your benefits. After reporting it, go toyour local CWA in order to get a replacement card. Youmay receive up to two replacement cards at no charge.After you have received two cards, you will be charged areplacement fee of $2.00 for each additional card.When do I receive my benefits?u You will receive your benefits on the same dayevery month.u If your case closes and you have benefits on yourFamilies First card, you can still use those benefitsuntil they are gone.u If you do not use any of your cash benefits for threemonths, your case will be closed and you will not beable to use the remaining cash benefits.u If you do not use any food benefits on your card forsix months, your case will be suspended and youwill not be able to use the remaining benefits. Youwill have to contact your local CWA to see if you areeligible for the remaining food benefits.u If you receive your account balance(s) and theamount is different than you expect, contact yourlocal CWA.It’s Illegal.Families First cards may not be used to accesscash benefits from the following locations:u Liquor Stores;u Casinos/gaming establishments; andu Retail establishments providing adult entertainment,such as strip clubs.It is a crime to sell your card and PIN to others!If a violation is determined, you will be sanctioned and:u you will have to pay back any benefits that wereobtained illegally.u you will be disqualified from the program.u you will be referred for criminal prosecution.Produced by DHS Office of Publications 12/17This institution is an equal opportunity provider.New Jersey Department of Human ServicesDivision of Family DevelopmentNJENBR04 12/17How do I use my card at the grocery store?u You can use your card at the grocery store tospend your NJ SNAP benefits.u You can also use your card at the grocery store tospend your cash benefits for items that cannot bepaid for with NJ SNAP.u At some stores, you can use your card to withdrawyour cash benefits.u Before you begin shopping, make sure the storeaccepts the card; look for the Quest ® logo inthe windows or on the doors. If you don’t see theQuest ® logo, go to thecourtesy counter and askif the store accepts theFamilies First card.u Tell the clerk that you want to use your card.u Slide your card through the machine.u Choose FOOD or CASH.u Enter your PIN on the keypad.REMEMBER: Save your receipt so that you knowyour balance the next time you go shopping.What happens if a store’s EBT machine isn’tworking?Even if a store’s EBT machines aren’t working, you maystill be able to use your card. The store cashier can usea paper voucher and call to get telephone approval foryour purchase.How do I use my card at an Automated TellerMachine (ATM)?If you are receiving a Work First New Jersey welfarecash benefit, you may get cash and check your balanceat an ATM. Look for the Quest ® logo. If you see theQuest ® logo, you can use your card at that machine.Here’s how:Follow the ATM instructions for scanning or entering yourcard.u Enter your PIN.u Choose the Cash Withdrawal or Balance Inquiryoption. (You cannot check your NJ SNAP balanceat an ATM.)u Select the CHECKING option.u If your transaction is approved, the ATM willgive you your cash and print a receipt when thetransaction is finished.u Keep your receipt and don’t forget to take your cardand your cash.You will have three free cash withdrawals everymonth. Each extra withdrawal will cost you 40¢.This fee will be taken out of your cash account.There is no charge for balance inquiries at an ATM.How do I find out how much money is in my NJSNAP and cash accounts?1. Go to www.NJFamiliesFirst.com where you canview your current card balance and transactionhistory, as well as report lost or stolen cards and viewprogram materials.2. Call Customer Service at 1-800-997-3333, whereyou can use the automated phone system to get yourbalance.3. Go to an ATM and request a balance check (not allATMs provide account balances) or check your lastreceipt. You cannot get your NJ SNAP balance at anATM, only your cash balance.Welcome to theNew Jersey EBT Program!You’re on your way to enjoying a safe and easy wayto get your NJ SNAP, formerly Food Stamps, andcash benefits.What is EBT?EBT, which stands for Electronic Benefits Transfer, is aprocess that allows you to use your Families First cardto get benefits that are deposited into an account. Yourcard is similar to a bank card and is protected with aPersonal Identification Number (PIN).Do Not Throw Your Card Away!You will not receive a new card each month.If you receive child care assistance, pleasecontact your Child Care Resource and Referral agency(CCR&R) so your Families First card (used for TANFand/or NJ SNAP) can also be used for child careservices. If you do not receive child care assistance,there is no need to call the CCR&R.

Interim Reporting Form (IRF)
Interim Reporting Form (IRF)\nAn IRF is sent to the household at the four-month or ten-month mark, depending on whether your certification period is for 12 months or 24 months. The IRF comes with a return envelope provided or you can drop off at your County Social Service Agency.\n. You can view a sample IRF form here.\nRequired reportable IRF changes:\n\nA change of gross unearned income of more than $100.00.\nA change in gross earned income of more than $100.00.\nA change in residence and the resulting change in shelter cost.\nA change in the members of your SNAP household.\nA change in child support payments of more than $50.\nLottery or gambling winnings of $4,250 or more.
Internet,
Internet, usted dedicará menos
Internships;
Interviews
Interviews – You are not required to complete an interview to apply or recertify for SNAP until October 2024. Your County Social Service Agency may still schedule an interview or call you to clarify information on your application. Your application will not be denied/your case will not be closed due to a missed interview. However, you should follow-up if the county reaches out so your application may be processed more quickly and to ensure you get the correct amount of benefits. After October 2024, interviews will be a required part of the process.

Jimbo la New Jersey
Jimbo la New JerseyPhil Murphy, Gavana | Sheila Oliver, Naibu wa GavanaIdara ya Huduma kwa BinadamuSarah Adelman, KamishnaFAIDA ZA DHARURA ZA ZIADA ZA SNAPZITAKOMESHWA FEBRUARI 2023Kwa sababu ya badiliko la hivi karibuni la sheria ya shirikisho, faida zaziada za muda ambazo umekuwa ukipokea zinazojulikana kama Mgaowa Dharura wa SNAP zinakomeshwa. Hii inamaanishwa kuwa utapokeamsaada wako wa kawaida wa SNAP kuanzia Machi 1, 2023. Kiasi chachini zaidi cha mswada aa SNAP wa kila mwezi sasa ni $95 katika jimbola New Jersey.NINAWEZA KUPATA WAPI HABARI KUHUSUMSAADA NINAOPATA?Msaada wa kawaida na msaada wa ziada wa EA huorodheshwatofauti. Ikiwa utaendelea kustahili kupata SNAP, utapokeamsaada wako wa kawaida tu kuanzia Machi. Utapokea baruamwezi wa Februari itakayoonyesha kiasi chako cha msaadawa kawaida, au unaweza:• Ingia ConnectEBT ambayo ni programu ya simu ya mkononi• Enda mtandaoni kwa www.njfamiliesfirst.com• Piga simu kwa nambari ambayo inapatikana nyuma ya kadiyako ya EBT Family first - 1-800-997-3333UNAHITAJI MSAADAKUHSIANA NARASILMALI ZA MSAADAWA CHAKULA?Tuma kodi yako ya anwanikwa ujumbe mfupi kwa898-211Nenda mtandaoni kwanj211.org/njsnapkwa rasilmali za chakulaNew JerseyWasiliana na bodi ya eneolako la huduma kwa jamiiTembeleaNJSNAP.govUNA MASWALI?IKIWA WEWE HUPATA FAIDA ZA SNAP ZA MSAADA WA CHAKULASASISHO MUHIMUFEB
Jimbo la New JerseyPhil Murphy, Gavana | Tahesha Way, Lt. GavanaIdara ya Huduma za BinadamuSarah Adelman, KamishnaMambo ya Chakula Msaada SNAP kwa ajiliya watu wazima wazee Zaidi ya 60Ongeza Bajeti Yako ya Ununuzi wa Vyakula na SNAP!Ni muhimu kujua kwamba SNAP ya kaya inajumuishamtu yeyote anayeishi na kula pamoja, lakini wazeewanaweza kuomba peke yao, hata wakati wanaishina wengine.Kwa wengi wa waombaji, mapato yako ya kila mwezi yakaya haipaswi kuwa juu kuliko kiasi katika chati hapachini. Hata hivyo, ikiwa mshiriki wa kaya ana umri wamiaka 60 au zaidi au ana ulemavu, bado wanawezakustahiki hata kama mapato yao ya jumla yanazidikiasi hiki.Unapokuwa na mapato ya kawaida, dola za ziada za kununua chakula zinaweza kukusaidiasana! Katika New Jersey, kiwango cha chini cha kila mwezi cha SNAP ambacho unawezakupata, ikiwa unastahili, ni $95 – ambayo ni $1,140 ya ziada ya kununua chakula kwa mwaka!Faida zako pia zinaweza kuwa kubwa zaidi ikiwa una gharama za matibabu, nyumba nahuduma za umma.Kuomba kwa SNAP leo katika bodi ya kaunti yako ya huduma za kijamii au tembelea NJSNAP.govna uende kwenye “GET SNAP” ili kupata Navigator ya SNAP.Ukubwa wa kaya - Mapato ya kila mwezi(Oktoba 2023 – Septemba 2024)1 $2,2482 $3,041Kila mwanakaya wa ziada Ongeza $793Kama unahitaji msaada, nenda kwenye bodi ya kaunti yako ya huduma za kijamii au tembeleaNJSNAP.gov na uende kwenye “GET SNAP” ili kupata Navigator ya SNAP, ili ikusaidie kuomba.MAMBO YA SNAP KWA AJILI YAWATU WAZIMA WAZEEHakuna mahitaji ya kazi kwa mtu yeyoteumri wa miaka 60 na zaidi.Unaweza kubaki na haki kwa miezi24 kabla ya kesi yako lazima upya.Hakuna haja ya kwenda binafsi kuombaau kukamilisha mchakato wa maombiyako - kila kitu kinaweza kufanywa kwasimu au mtandaoni.

LET OP:
LET OP: Het opgeven van de Amerikaanse Burger Service Nummers (Social Security Numbers - SSNs) van alle leden van hethuishouden is toegestaan op grond van de Amerikaanse Food Stamp Act van 1977, zoals gewijzigd, 7 U.S.C. 2011-2036; AmerikaansPubliekrecht 104.193 vereist het indienen van SSNs voor alle natuurlijke personen die WFNJ aanvragen. Uw SSN zal gebruiktworden om vast te stellen of uw huishouden in aanmerking komt of in aanmerking zal blijven komen voor het NJ SNAP Programmaen/of WFNJ programma. We zullen deze informatie controleren door middel van computergestuurde vergelijkingsprogramma's.Deze informatie zal ook gebruikt worden om te controleren of deze in overeenstemming is met de regels van het programma en voorhet programmabeheer. Deze informatie kan worden doorgegeven aan andere federale en overheidsinstellingen voor officieelonderzoek en wetshandhavers ten behoeve van de aanhouding van personen die op de vlucht zijn voor wettelijke vervolging. Alseen NJ SNAP vordering ontstaat tegen uw huishouden, kan de informatie over deze aanvraag, inclusief alle SSNs, wordenvoorgelegd aan federale en overheidsinstellingen, evenals particuliere incassobureaus, voor vorderingen. Het verstrekken van deverzochte informatie, waaronder de SSN van ieder lid van het huishouden, is vrijwillig voor NJ SNAP doeleinden. Wanneer u dezeinformatie echter niet verstrekt zal dit leiden tot weigering van NJ SNAP bijstand en/of WFNJ bijstand voor uw huishouden.

Medical Resources\nNew Jersey FamilyCareNJ FamilyCare provides health coverage to a variety of populations and includes a wide-range of services such as: doctor visits, hospital services, prescriptions, vision care, mental health care, dental, nursing home care and other healthcare services.\nPharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged & Disabled (PAAD)The Pharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged and Disabled (PAAD) program is a state-funded program that helps eligible seniors and individuals with disabilities save money on their prescription drug costs.

Meeting the maximum allowable income for your household size does not guarantee you are eligible for SNAP. You can screen for SNAP in five minutes to find out if you may be eligible for food assistance, cash assistance and more. Click here to screen and apply in 20 to 40 minutes.

More Information
More Information \n\n\n\n\n\n\nFor more information on New Jersey’s SNAP E&T program, contact your case worker or your County Social Service Agency.\nFor more information about activities, you can visit the Department of Labor’s website at www.nj.gov/labor/careerservices. There, you can schedule an appointment with your local One-Stop Career Center for personalized, one-on-one career support. Be sure to explore the website’s many other resources, including a calendar of job fairs, specific job and apprenticeship openings, special supports for groups like ex-offenders and people with disabilities, and numerous other tools to help you choose, apply for, and get a job.
More information about staying on SNAP, including IRFs and recertification can be found in the SNAP Recipient section of
More information about staying on SNAP, including IRFs and recertification can be found in the SNAP Recipient section of www.NJSNAP.gov.

My spouse and I are enrolled in college at the same time and we have a child under the age of 6. How does this work for us?
My spouse and I are enrolled in college at the same time and we have a child under the age of 6. How does this work for us? \n\n\n\n\n\n\nOne parent can claim one child under the age of 6. If you have other children under 6, the other parent can claim that child/children for college student eligibility. If you only have one child under the age of 6, the other parent may still be eligible if they meet one of the other college student eligibility requirements listed above.

MyNJHelps Online Application Overview - English
MyNJHelps Online Application Overview - Spanish
MyNJHelps account, you can now create one to check
MyNJHelps is the online application system for New Jersey's Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and WorkFirst NJ (WFNJ) programs. It is designed to help you get food and cash assistance support for you and your family.
MyNJHelps.gov
MyNJHelps\nMyNJHelps is the online application system for New Jersey's Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and WorkFirst NJ (WFNJ) programs. It is designed to help you get food and cash assistance support for you and your family.\nThe videos below provide a brief overview of MyNJHelps.  They walk you through how to create an account.\nOnce you have a MyNJHelps account, you will be able to start an application and submit it or save it to finish later. You will also be able to upload supporting documents and check the status of your submitted application.\n MyNJHelps Online Application Overview - English\nMyNJHelps Online Application Overview - Spanish
Myanmar (Burmese)
N J S N A P
N'Ko
N.B.: L’elencazione dei numeri del Social Security (SSNs) per ciascun membro del nucleo familiare è permessa ai sensi del Food
N.B.: L’elencazione dei numeri del Social Security (SSNs) per ciascun membro del nucleo familiare è permessa ai sensi del FoodStamp Act del 1977, emendato come 7 U.S.C. 2011-2036; la Public Law 104-193 richiede la sottomissione dei numeri del SSN perciascun individuo che richiede i sussidi WFNJ. Il SSN del richiedente verrà impiegato per determinare se il nucleo familiare èidoneo oppure continua ad essere idoneo alla partecipazione al Programma NJ SNAP e/o WFNJ. Ci faremo carico di verificare leinformazioni fornite attraverso programmi informatici di corrispondenza. Le informazioni verranno usate per monitorare il rispettodelle normative relative ai programmi e per la gestione dei programmi stessi. Esse potrebbero essere divulgate ad agenzie federali estatali per analisi ufficiali, e alle autorità di legge aventi il compito di perseguire coloro che si sottraggono alla giustizia. Qualora ilrichiedente presenta una domanda di sussidio NJ SNAP a favore del suo nucleo familiare, le informazioni in essa contenute, inclusi inumeri SSN, potrebbero essere divulgate ad agenzie federali e statali e ad agenzie private di recupero crediti. La sottomissione delleinformazioni richieste, inclusi i numeri SSN per ciascun membro del nucleo familiare, è volontario per le domande di sussidi NJSNAP. Resta inteso, comunque, che la mancata sottomissione di tali informazioni comporterà la negazione dei sussidi NJ SNAPbenefits e/o WFNJ per il nucleo familiare del richiedente.
NA
NA RZECZ KOGO
NAAM KIND/VOLWASSENE

NJ SNAP Brochure - EnglishNJ SNAP Brochure - Spanish\nSNAP Facts for Older Adults - English/SpanishSNAP Facts for Older Adults - EnglishSNAP Facts for Older Adults - SpanishSNAP Facts for Older Adults - ArabicSNAP Facts for Older Adults - BengaliSNAP Facts for Older Adults - DariSNAP Facts for Older Adults - DutchSNAP Facts for Older Adults - FarsiSNAP Facts for Older Adults - GujaratiSNAP Facts for Older Adults - Haitian CreoleSNAP Facts for Older Adults - HindiSNAP Facts for Older Adults - ItalianSNAP Facts for Older Adults - KoreanSNAP Facts for Older Adults - PashtoSNAP Facts for Older Adults - PolishSNAP Facts for Older Adults - Portuguese BrazilianSNAP Facts for Older Adults - PunjabiSNAP Facts for Older Adults - RussianSNAP Facts for Older Adults - Simplified ChineseSNAP Facts for Older Adults - SwahiliSNAP Facts for Older Adults - Traditional ChineseSNAP Facts for Older Adults - UkranianSNAP Facts for Older Adults - Urdu
NJ SNAP Brochure - Spanish
NJ SNAP benefits are issued on a Families First Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card that works like a debit card. This card can be used in most grocery stores and some participating farmers market. You can find participating grocery stores by clicking here.
NJ SNAP benefits are issued on a Families First Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card that works like a debit card. This card can be used in most grocery stores and some participating farmers market. You can find participating grocery stores by clicking here.   \nBenefits can be used online at:  \n\nALDI\nAmazon\nBJ's  \nFood Bazaar\nShopRite \nStop&Shop\nThe Fresh Grocer\nWalmart  \nFoodtown (only Foodtown locations in Monmouth County: Port Monmouth, Atlantic Highlands, Red Bank, Sea Girt, and Ocean) \n\nRecipients seeking to order from these online stores should check with their local store about online SNAP availability. Benefits cannot be used to pay for delivery or other service fees. Be sure to confirm an online store delivers to your home address before ordering.  Some online orders are completed using Instacart.  More information about how to use your EBT benefits on Instacart can be found here.\nBenefits are deposited into your account when the application is approved. Each month that you are still eligible, benefits will be deposited at the beginning of the month. Your benefits cannot be given to another person and you cannot sell the items you purchased with your SNAP benefits.The card can be used at the grocery store, like you would use a debit card, to spend your NJ SNAP benefits. You will need to enter a secret Personal Identification Number (PIN), which should never be shared with anyone.
NJ SNAP can be used to buy food like:
NJ SNAP can be used to buy food like: \n\nFruits and vegetables;\nBeans, fish, poultry, meat;\nRice, bread, tortillas, cereal;\nMilk and cheese; and\nSeeds and plants that produce food.
NJ SNAP cannot be used to buy:
NJ SNAP cannot be used to buy:\n\nAlcohol, tobacco, cigarettes;\nNon-food items (pet food, toilet paper, diapers, soap, etc.);\nVitamins and medicine;\nHot and prepared food or meals.\n\n \nIf you already have a Families First card, you can create an online account by visiting NJFamiliesFirst.com. If you have an account, you can check your balance, change your PIN and/or report a lost or stolen card.\n\nEBT Brochure (English) (PDF)\nEBT Brochure (Spanish)(PDF)\n\nIf you are receiving cash assistance, when you are shopping in person, you can use your Families First card to withdraw cash from an ATM with the Quest® logo. You also can use the card to buy items that are not allowed under NJ SNAP.

NJ SNAP-4 07/20 1NEW JERSEY SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (NJ SNAP)INTERIM REPORTING FORMFOR MONTH OF SEPTEMBER 2021RETURN TO: NJ Division of Family DevelopmentOffice of NJ SNAP - IRF UnitPO BOX 718TRENTON, NJ 08625 or FAX: (609) 341-2250DATE: DATE MAILEDCLIENT NAME: YOUR NAMENUMBER: YOUR CASE NUMBER**MUST BE RETURNED BY OCTOBER 15th 2021 OR YOUR CASE WILL CLOSE DECEMBER 1st 2021**INSTRUCTIONSYou must submit a new interim reporting form. We need this information to make sure that you are receiving the rightamount of SNAP benefits.For the questions below you must provide current information for all the people in your household. You can use a separatesheet of paper to explain any of your answers or give additional information. Please send copies on full size paper, and donot use staples or tape when sending in your form.You must complete, sign and return this form to the above address, or to your local Board of Social Services, by the dateshown on this page. Do not send in a form from a past reporting period. If you need help to complete this form, call theDFD SNAP Unit at (800) 792-9773.Able-bodied adults without dependents (ABAWDS) must report when their weekly work hours fall below the 20-hour weeklyaverage as well as when their gross income exceeds 185% of the federal poverty level (FPL).NOTICE• If this form is late or incomplete, you may not receive your NJ SNAP timely.• If you do not return this form, action will be taken to close your case.Your current monthly NJ SNAP BENEFITS are $234.00 based on the number of people in your household and thehousehold's countable income.SINCE YOUR MOST RECENT SNAP APPLICATION YES NO Additional Instructions(Select Yes or No with an 'X' with black or blue ink):1. Has your Household moved? If Yes, complete section 12. Has your Household's monthly rent/mortgage cost changed? If Yes, complete section 23. Did anyone move into, or leave, your household? If Yes, complete section 34. Have you, or anyone in your household, started a new job, losta job, or started to receive income from a new source?If Yes, complete section 45. Has your Household's monthly EARNED income (before taxes)changed by more than $100?If Yes, complete section 4.16. Has your Household's monthly UNEARNED income changedby more than $100?If Yes, complete section 4.27. Is any household member paying new child support for a child notliving in the home or did existing payments change more than $50?If Yes, complete section 58. Has anyone in your household won $3,500 or more in lottery orgambling winnings?If you have answered NO to all of these questions you may skip to the Last Page and sign the Certification section.SAMPLE FORM

NJ SNAP-এর জন্য আবেদন করার সময় আপনি যদি আমাদের না বলেন (বা প্রতিপাদন করেন) যে আপনি এই খরচগুলির মধ্যে কোনোটি বহন করছেন, এমন কি তাহলেও আপনি পরবর্তীকালে একটি আয় বিয়োজন পেতে পারেন, যদি আপনি আমাদের বলেন (বা প্রতিপাদন করেন) যে আপনি এই খরচগুলির মধ্যে কোনোটি ...

NJ SNAP‐200 (New 04/19)
NJ SNAP‐200 (New 04/19)Submit completed form to Agency listed below:Students ‐ please keep a copy of this completed form for your records.New Jersey Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (NJ SNAP)Student Eligibility Verification FormThis form is used to help the County Board of Social Services determine if the student listed below meets theNJ SNAP student eligibility criteria. This form must be completed and signed by a school official from theFinancial Aid Office, Office of the Registrar or the Office of the Dean for Student Affairs. The school may returnthe completed form to the student or send directly to the Agency listed above on the student’s behalf. A copyof the form also may be given to the student for the student’s personal records.SECTION 1: Completed by County Board of Social ServicesClient Name: Date of Birth:SNAP Case No.: Student ID No.:County of Residence: Client Phone:SECTION 2: Completed by School OfficialRequired:Name of School:Is the student enrolled in school at least half‐time? Yes NoSelect the appropriate student participation:Is the student approved to participate in a federal or state work study? Yes Noa. Date student was approved for work study:b. List semester(s) approved for work study:ORIs the student enrolled in an approved Career and Technical Education program? Yes Noa. NJ SNAP를 신청할 때 비록 당신이 이러한 지출 중 하나가 발생하고 있다고 우리에게 말하지 않더라도, 나중에 이러한 비용 중 하나를 지불하고 있다고 나중에 우리에게 말하면(또는 확인하면) 소득공제가 됩니다.  비용 발생을 보고하지 않은 달에 대하여 소득공제가 소급되지 않습니다.
NJ Summer EBT is a child nutrition program intended to reduce hunger and food insecurity for children who lose access to free school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) and School Breakfast Program (SBP) during the summer when school is not in session. For more information on the new Summer EBT program, go to www.nj.gov/summerebt.

NOT
NOTA: La presentación de los números de Seguro Social (SSN) de todos los miembros del hogar está autorizada según la Ley de
NOTA: La presentación de los números de Seguro Social (SSN) de todos los miembros del hogar está autorizada según la Ley deCupones para Alimentos de 1977, con sus modificaciones, el Título 7 del Código de los Estados Unidos (U.S.C), secciones 2011-2036;la Ley Pública 104-193 exige la presentación de los SSN de todas las personas que se inscriban en el programa WFNJ. Su SSN seutilizará para determinar si su hogar es elegible o sigue siéndolo para participar en los programas NJ SNAP o WFNJ. Verificaremosesta información a través de los programas de cotejo electrónico. Esta información también se utilizará para monitorear elcumplimiento de las reglamentaciones de los programas y para administrar los programas. Esta información puede divulgarse a otrasagencias federales y estatales para una revisión oficial, y a oficiales del orden público para poder aprehender a personas prófugaspor evadir la ley. Si surgiera un reclamo por parte de NJ SNAP en contra de su hogar, la información que se encuentra en esta solicitud,incluidos todos los SSN, puede ser derivada a agencias federales y estatales, así como a agencias de cobro de reclamos, para tomarmedidas con respecto a dicho reclamo. La presentación de la información solicitada, incluidos los SSN de cada miembro del hogar,es voluntaria para los fines de NJ SNAP. Sin embargo, si no se proporciona esta información, se rechazará la solicitud de beneficiosdel NJ SNAP o WFNJ para su hogar.
NOTE:
NOTE: The submission of Social Security numbers (SSNs) for all household members is authorized under the Food Stamp Act of1977, as amended, 7 U.S.C. 2011-2036; Public Law 104-193 requires the submission of SSNs for all individuals applying for WFNJ.Your SSN will be used to determine whether your household is eligible or continues to be eligible to participate in the NJ SNAPProgram and/or WFNJ program. We will verify this information through computer matching programs. This information will also beused to monitor compliance with program regulations and for program management. This information may be disclosed to otherFederal and State agencies for official examination, and to law enforcement officials for the purpose of apprehending persons fleeingto avoid the law. If a NJ SNAP claim arises against your household, the information on this application, including all SSNs, may bereferred to Federal and State agencies, as well as private claims collection agencies, for claims action. The providing of the requestedinformation, including the SSN of each household member, is voluntary for NJ SNAP purposes. However, failure to provide thisinformation will result in the denial of NJ SNAP benefits and/or WFNJ benefits to your household.

Need Help with Your Application? Ask a SNAP Navigator.
Need Help with Your Application? Ask a SNAP Navigator.\nApplying for SNAP can be confusing. A SNAP Navigator can help you apply and help you keep your benefits so you can get the food assistance you need. \nSNAP Navigators will walk you through:\n\nHow SNAP works;\neligibility requirements;\nwhat documents you need to apply;\nthe application process, and;\nhow to keep your SNAP benefits.\n\nThey also can answer questions and correct misconceptions about SNAP to help you decide if SNAP is right for you. This help is free and confidential.
Need Someone to Help You With Your Application?
Need Someone to Help You With Your Application?\nSNAP Navigators teach you about SNAP availability, eligibility requirements, can answer your questions about applying and assist you with your SNAP application. They also can help you learn if you may be eligible for other programs, such as Work First New Jersey cash assistance.  You can learn more about our SNAP Navigator program on the Get Help Applying page. \nOur current SNAP Navigator agencies are listed below.  To find the agency that works in your county, visit the Get Help Applying page to view the counties each agency serves and the contact information for the agency.\n\nCommunity FoodBank of New Jersey\nCUMAC/ECHO\nCumberland Cape Atlantic YMCA \nFood Bank of South Jersey \nFulfill\nHamilton Area YMCA\nLakewood Resource and Referral Center\nMeadowlands Area YMCA\nMercy Center\nNorwescap\nRaritan Bay Area YMCA\nRaritan Valley YMCA\nSussex County YMCA\nTzu Chi\nUnited Way of Greater Mercer County\nWayne YMCA\nYMCA of Montclair\n\nBe aware that there other agencies that might claim to be “SNAP consultants,” asking you for personal information to complete a pre-approved SNAP application or telling you that an application was initiated on your behalf. If you think a letter or text is a scam, do not reply at all. If you do not know if a request for personal information is real, contact your County Social Service Agency.\nYou should never be asked to pay for help filling out an application. There is no charge.
Need help activating card
Need help applying? A SNAP Navigator can answer your questions and can assist with your application.  To find the agency that works in your county, visit the Get Help Applying page to view the counties each agency serves and the contact information for the agency.

Nessun requisito lavorativo per persone
Nessun requisito lavorativo per personedai 60 anni in su.L’idoneità è valida per 24 mesi,poi il caso viene rinnovato.Non serve fare richiesta o completareil processo di richiesta di persona:il procedimento può essere seguitotelefonicamente oppure online.Stato del New JerseyPhil Murphy, Governatore | Tahesha Way, VicegovernatoreDipartimento dei Servizi UmaniSarah Adelman, CommissarioInformazioni sull’assistenza alimentare SNAPper persone oltre i 60 anniAumenta il tuo budget per la spesa con SNAP!Nota importante: il nucleo familiare SNAP includele persone che vivono insieme e condividono i pasti,ma le persone anziane possono fare domandaesclusivamente per conto proprio, anche se vivonocon altri.Per la maggior parte delle persone richiedenti, ilreddito mensile del nucleo familiare non deve superarei valori indicati nella tabella di seguito. Tuttavia, se unmembro del nucleo familiare ha dai 60 anni in su o haun riconoscimento di disabilità, potrebbe comunquerientrare nella categoria idonea, anche se il redditolordo supera tali valori.Quando le entrate sono fisse, qualche dollaro in più per comprare gli alimentari non fa maimale! In New Jersey, il benefit SNAP mensile minimo che puoi ricevere, in caso di idoneità,è di 95 $. In un anno, sono ben 1.140 $ extra per fare la spesa!Questo benefit può anche aumentare se devi sostenere personalmente spese mediche, perla casa e le bollette.Fai subito richiesta per SNAP presso il consiglio della contea per i servizi sociali oppure visitail sito NJSNAP.gov e vai su “GET SNAP” per trovare un Consulente SNAP.Dimensioni del nucleo familiare -Reddito lordo mensile(Ottobre 2023 – Settembre 2024)1 2.248 $2 3.041 $Per ogni membro aggiuntivo 793 $ in piùSe ti serve aiuto, recati al consiglio della contea per i servizi sociali oppure visita il sito NJSNAP.gove vai su “GET SNAP” per trovare un Consulente SNAP che ti aiuterà con la richiesta.INFORMAZIONI SNAPPER PERSONE ANZIANE

New Jersey FamilyCare
New Jersey FamilyCareNJ FamilyCare provides health coverage to a variety of populations and includes a wide-range of services such as: doctor visits, hospital services, prescriptions, vision care, mental health care, dental, nursing home care and other healthcare services.
New Jersey Higher Education Student Assistance Authority
New Jersey Lifeline
New Jersey LifelineThe Lifeline utility assistance program offers an annual utility benefit and is administered by the New Jersey Division of Aging Services.
New Jersey One Stop Career Center
New Jersey Residence (NOT APPLICABLE FOR NJ SNAP PURPOSES)
New Jersey Summer EBT
New Jersey Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program
New Jersey Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (NJ SNAP)
New Jersey has a minimum monthly SNAP benefit amount of $95.  If you apply for SNAP and are approved to receive the federal minimum payment or any amount less than $95, New Jersey will add a supplemental payment so that the amount you receive equals $95.
New Jersey is approved for the following waivers that will continue to help you apply for and stay on SNAP more easily. These waivers will remain in place following the end of the federal Public Health Emergency.
New Jersey minimalny miesięczny zasiłek SNAP, który możesz otrzymać, jeśli się kwalifikujesz,
New Jersey ایالت، معاون فرماندارSheila Oliver | ، فرماندارPhil Murphyدپارتمان خدمات انسانی، کمیسرSarah Adelmanیابدپایان می 2023 فوری در فوریه SNAP مزایای اضافیبه دلیل تغییر جدید در قانون فدرال، مزایای موقت اضافی که با نام تخصیص2023 مارس 1 این یعنی از .یابداید، پایان میدریافت کرده SNAP فوریماهانه SNAP حداقل مزایای .معمولی را دریافت خواهید کرد SNAP مزایای.است $95 هم اکنون New Jersey درتوانم اطالعات مفصل درباره مزایای خوداز کجا میدریافت کنم؟به طور جداگانه فهرست EA مزایای عادی و مزایای اضافیباشید، فقط از ماه مارس مزایای SNAP اگر واجدشرایط .اندشدهای از طریقدر ماه فوریه نامه .عادی خود را دریافت خواهید کردپست دریافت خواهید کرد که در آن میزان مزایای معمولی شما:توانیدمشخص شده است، یا می وارد شوید ConnectEBT به برنامه تلفن همراه.بروید www.njfamiliesfirst.com به صورت آنالین بهخود تماس EBT Families First با شماره پشت کارت1-800-997-3333 - بگیریددر مورد منابع کمکی غذاییبه کمک نیاز دارید؟کدپستی خود را بهپیامک کنید 898-211برای اطالعات درباره منابع غذاییبه صورت آنالین بهnj211.org/njsnapبرویدNew Jerseyبا هیئت خدمات اجتماعیمحلی خود تماس بگیریدNJSNAP.gov ازدیدن کنید سؤالی دارید؟کنیددریافت می  SNAP اگر مزایای کمکی غذاییبروزرسانی مهمبروزرسانی مهمفوریه
New Jersey ایالتفرماندار .Sheila Oliver, معاون فرماندار ,Phil Murphyاداره خدمات بشری، عضو هیئتSarah Adelmanبه پایان می رسد 2023 اضطراری در فبروری SNAP فواید اضافیبه دلیل تغییر اخیر در قانون فدرال، فواید موقت اضافی که به عنوان تخصیصاین بدان معناست که از اول .یابداید به پایان میدریافت کرده SNAP اضطراریSNAP حداقل فواید .معمولی خود را دریافت خواهید کرد SNAP فواید 2023 مارچ.دالر است 95 اکنون New Jersey ماهانه دراز کجا می توانم جزئیات فایده خود را دریافت کنم؟به طور جداگانه فهرست شده EA فایده معمولی و فایده اضافیبمانید، فقط از ماه مارچ فایده عادی SNAP اگر واجد شرایط .استدر ماه فبروری نامه ای از طریق پست .خود را دریافت خواهید کرددریافت خواهید کرد که نشان دهنده میزان فایده معمولی شما:است، یا می توانیدوارد شوید ConnectEBT به برنامه تیلفون همراه بهآنالین بروید www.njfamiliesfirst.com به- خود EBT Families First با شماره پشت اولین کارتتماس بگیرید 1-800-997-3333برای منابع کمک غذایی بهکمک نیاز دارید؟کود پستی خود را بهبه طور پیام بفرستید 898-211انالین بروید بهnj211.org/njsnapبرای خدمات غذاNew Jerseyبه هیئت خدمات اجتماعیمحلی خود تماس بگیریدبازدید کنیدNJSNAP.gov ها دارید؟سوالبهره مند شوید SNAP اگر از فواید کمک غذاییبه روز رسانی مهمفبروری
New Jersey والية، محافظ املالزمSheila Oliver | ، املحافظPhil Murphyإدارة الخدمات اإلنسانية، املفوضSarah Adelman2023 اإلضافية الخاصة بالطوارئ يف فرباير SNAP تنتهي مزايانظرًا للتغيري األخري يف القانون الفيدرايل، تنتهي املزايا املؤقتة اإلضافية التي تلقيتها واملعروفة باسمالعادية الخاصة بك اعتبارًا SNAP هذا يعني أنك ستتلقى ميزة .SNAP مخصصات الطوارئ.$95 هو اآلن New Jersey الشهرية يف SNAP الحد األدىن ملزايا .2023 مارس 1 منأين ميكنني الحصول عىل تفاصيل املزايا الخاصة يب؟إذا كنت ال تزال مؤهال ً لربنامج .اإلضافية بشكل منفصل EA يتم رسد املزايا العادية ومزاياستتلقى خطابًا بالربيد يف فرباير .، فستتلقى مخصصاتك العادية فقط بدءًا من شهر مارسSNAP:يوضح مبلغ املخصصات العادية، أو ميكنكللهاتف املحمول ConnectEBT قم بتسجيل الدخول إىل تطبيقwww.njfamiliesfirst.com قم بزيارة االنرتنت من خالل- الخاصة بك EBT Families First اتصل بالرقم املوجود عىل ظهر بطاقة1-800-997-3333هل تحتاج إىل مساعدة يف موارداملساعدة الغذائية؟أرسل الرمز الربيدي الخاص بك إىلأرسل الرمز الربيدي الخاص بك إىل898-211قم بزيارة اإلنرتنت من خاللقم بزيارة اإلنرتنت من خاللnj211.org/njsnapللموارد الغذائيةللموارد الغذائيةNew Jerseyاتصل باملجلس املحيل للخدماتاالجتامعية NJSNAP.gov قم بزيارة هل لديك أسئلة؟SNAP إذا حصلت عىل مزايا املساعدة الغذائية منتحديث هامتحديث هامفرباير
New Jersey राज्यPhil Murphy, गवर््नर | Sheila Oliver, लेफ्टिर्ेंट गवर््नरमानव सेवा ववभागSarah Adelman, अधिकारीआपातकालीन SNAP अवतररक्त लाभ फरवरी 2023 में समाप्त हो रहे हैंफैडरल कार्ूर् मेें हाल ही मेें ककए गए बदलाव के कारण, आपको SNAP आपातकालीर् आवंटर् के रू प मेें ज्ात अततररक्त अस्ायी लाभ समेाप्त हो रहे हैं। इसका मे तलब है कक आप 1 मे ार््न , 2023 से अपर्ा तर्यममेतSNAP लाभ प् ाप्त करें गे। New Jersey मेें न्ूर् तमे मे ाधसक SNAP लाभ अब $95 है।मैं अपना लाभ वववरण कहां से प् ाप्त कर सकता /सकती हूूँ ?वनयममत लाभ और EA अवतररक्त लाभ अलग- अलग सूचीबद्ध हैं । यदि आप SNAP के ललएपात्र बने रहते हैं , तो आपको माच्च से केवल अपना वनयममत लाभ ही ममलेगा। आपको फरवरी मेंमेल में एक पत्र प् ाप्त होगा जिसमें आपकी वनयममत लाभ राजि को दिखाया िाएगा, या आप:• ConnectEBT मे ोबाइल एप्लिकेशर् मेें लॉग इर् कर सकते हैं• www.njfamiliesfirst.com पर ऑर्लाइर् जाएं• अपर्े EBT Families First काड्न के पीछे कदए गए र्ं बर पर कॉल करें –1-800-997-3333क्ा भोिन सहायता संसाधनोंके संबंध में सहायता चाहहए?अपर्ा ज़़ि प कोडअपर्ा ज़़ि प कोड898-211 पर टेक्स्ट मेै सेज से भेजेंपर टेक्स्ट मेै सेज से भेजेंभोजर् संसािर्ों के ललएभोजर् संसािर्ों के ललएnj211.org/njsnapपर ऑर्लाइर् जाएंपर ऑर्लाइर् जाएंNew Jerseyसामेाज़जक सेवाओं के अपर्े स्ार्ीय बोड्न से संपक्न करेंNJSNAP.gov पर जाएंआपके कोई प्श्न हैं ?यकद आपको SNAP भोजर् सहायता लाभ ममेलते हैंमहत्वपूण्च अपडेटफरवरी
New Jersey স্ টেটPhil Murphy, গভর্্নর | Sheila Oliver, লেফটের্্যযান্ট গভর্্নরমানব স্ েবা ববভাগSarah Adelman, কমিশর্যারজরুবি SNAP- এি অবিবিক্ত েু ববধাগুবি স্ েব্রুয়াবি 2023-এ স্েষ হচ্ছেলফডযাটরে আইটর্ সযাম্প্রমিক পমরবি্নটর্র কযারটে, SNAP জরুরী বরযাদ্দ মিসযাটবপমরমিি আপর্যার প্ যাপ্ত অমিমরক্ত অস্যায়ী সু মবধযাগুমে লশষ িটয় যযাটছে। এর িযাটর্িে আপমর্ 1 িযাি্ন , 2023 লেটক আপর্যার মর্য়মিি SNAP সুমবধযা পযাটবর্।New Jersey-লি র্্য্যর্ িি িযামসক SNAP সুমবধযা এখর্ $95।আপর্যার সযািযামজক পমরটষবযামবষয়ক স্ যার্ীয় লবযাটড্ন রসযাটে লযযাগযাটযযাগ করুর্মভমজে করুর্NJSNAP.gov এই ঠিকযার্যায়প্রশ্নআচ্ে?আপমর্ যমি SNAP খযাি্য সিযায়িযা সু মবধযা পযার্গুরুত্বপূর্্ণ আপচ্েটগুরুত্বপূর্্ণ আপচ্েটআবম আমাি স্ ববনবেচ্টি ববস্াবিি স্ �াথায় স্পচ্ি পাবি ?বনয়বমি স্ ববনবেট এবং EA-এি অবিবিক্ত স্ ববনবেট আিাদাভাচ্বিাবি�াভুক্ত �িা হচ্য়চ্ে। আপবন যবদ SNAP-এি জন্য স্ যাগ্য থাচ্�ন,আপবন শু ধুমাত্র মার্্ণ মাচ্ে আপনাি বনয়বমি স্ ববনবেট পাচ্বন। আপবন স্েব্রুয়াবি মাচ্ে আপনা ি বনয়বমি স্ ববনবেচ্টি পবিমার্ বনচ্দ্ণে �চ্িো�চ্যাচ্গ এ�টি বর্ঠি পাচ্বন , অথবা আপবন যা �িচ্ি পাচ্িন:• ConnectEBT লিযাবযাইে অ্যযামলিটকশর্টিটি েগ ইর্ করুর্• অর্েযাইটর্ www.njfamiliesfirst.com এই ঠিকযার্যায় মভমজে করুর্• আপর্যার EBT Families First কযাটড্ন র মপছটর্র র্ম্ব রটিটি কেকরুর্ – 1-800-997-3333খাদ্য েহায়িা েংস্ানগুবিবনচ্য় োহায্য প্রচ্য় াজন ?আপর্যার মজপ লকযাডটি লেক্সেআপর্যার মজপ লকযাডটি লেক্সেকরুর্করুর্ 898-211 র্ম্ব টরর্ম্বটরখযাটি্যর সংস্যাটর্র জন্খযাটি্যর সংস্যাটর্র জন্অর্েযাইটর্ মভমজে করুর্অর্েযাইটর্ মভমজে করুর্nj211.org/njsnapএই ঠিকযার্যায়এই ঠিকযার্যায়New Jerseyস্েব্রুয়া বি
New Jersey રાજ્્યરાજ્્યPhil Murphy, ગવર્્નર | Sheila Oliver, લેફ્્ટર્ન્્ટ ગવર્્નરમાર્વ સંસાધર્ સેવાઓર્ો વવભાગમાર્વ સંસાધર્ સેવાઓર્ો વવભાગSarah Adelman, કવમશર્રઇમરજન્સસીઇમરજન્સસી SNAP વધારાર્ા લાભો ફેબ્રુઆરસીવધારાર્ા લાભો ફેબ્રુઆરસી 2023 માં સમાપ્્ત થઈ રહ્ા છેમાં સમાપ્્ત થઈ રહ્ા છેસંઘસી્ય કા્યદામાં ્ત ાજે્ત રર્ા ફેરફારર્ે લસીધે, ્ત મર્ે SNAP ઈમરજન્સસી ફાળવણસી ્ત રસીકે ઓળખા્તાવધારાર્ા કામચલાઉ લાભો સમાપ્્ત થઈ રહ્ા છે . આર્ો અથ્ન એ છે કે ્ત મર્ે 1 માચ્ન, 2023 થસી ્ત મારાવર્્યવમ્ત SNAP લાભ પ્ ાપ્્ત થશે. New Jersey માં લઘરુત્ત મ માવસક SNAP લાભ હવે $95 છે.મારા લાભર્સી વવગ્તો હરું ક્્ય ાંથસી મેળવસી શકરુંમારા લાભર્સી વવગ્તો હરું ક્્ય ાંથસી મેળવસી શકરું ?વર્્યવમ્ત લાભ અર્ે ઈમરજન્સસી ફાળવણસીવર્્યવમ્ત લાભ અર્ે ઈમરજન્સસી ફાળવણસી(Emergency Allotment,EA) વધારાર્ા લાભ અલગવધારાર્ા લાભ અલગ -અલગ સૂવચબદ્ધ છેઅલગ સૂવચબદ્ધ છે . જો ્ત મેજો ્ત મે SNAP મા્ટે પાત્રમા્ટે પાત્રરહેશોરહેશો, ્ત ો ્ત મર્ે ્ત મારા વર્્યવમ્ત લાભ ફક્્ત માચ્નથસી જ પ્ ાપ્્ત થશે્તો ્ત મર્ે ્ત મારા વર્્યવમ્ત લાભ ફક્્ત માચ્નથસી જ પ્ ાપ્્ત થશે. ્ત મર્ે ્તમર્ેફેબ્રુઆરસીમાં મેઇલમાં એક પત્ર પ્ ાપ્્ત થશે જેમાં ્ત મારસી વર્્યવમ્ત લાભર્સી રકમફેબ્રુઆરસીમાં મેઇલમાં એક પત્ર પ્ ાપ્્ત થશે જેમાં ્ત મારસી વર્્યવમ્ત લાભર્સી રકમસૂચવવામાં આવશે અથવા ્ત મેસૂચવવામાં આવશે અથવા ્ત મે :• ConnectEBT મોબાઇલ એવપ્લકેશર્માં લોગ ઇર્ કરસી શકો છો• www.njfamiliesfirst.com પર ઑર્લાઇર્ જ્ય શકો છો• ્ત મારા EBT Families First કાર્્નર્ સી પાછળ આપેલ ર્ં બર પર કૉલ કરો –1-800-997-3333ખાદ્ય સહા્ય સંસાધર્ોમાંખાદ્ય સહા્ય સંસાધર્ોમાંમદદર્સી જરૂર છેમદદર્સી જરૂર છે ? ્તમારો વપર્ કોર્્તમારો વપર્ કોર્898-211 પર ્ટેક્્સ્્ટ કરોપર ્ટેક્્સ્્ટ કરોપર ઑર્લાઇર્ જાઓપર ઑર્લાઇર્ જાઓnj211.org/njsnapખાદ્ય સંસાધર્ો મા્ટેખાદ્ય સંસાધર્ો મા્ટેNew Jersey્તમારા સામાવજક સેવાઓર્ા ્સ્થાવર્ક બોર્્નર્ો સંપક્ન કરોNJSNAP.gov ર્સી મરુલાકા્ત લોકોઈ પ્શ્ર્ ો છે?કોઈ પ્શ્ર્ ો છે?જો ્ત મર્ે પૂરક પોષણ સહા્ય કા્ય્નક્રમ SNAP ખોરાક સહા્ય પ્ ાપ્્ત થા્યમહત્વપૂણ્ન અપર્ે્ટમહત્વપૂણ્ન અપર્ે્ટફેબ્રુઆરસીફેબ્રુઆરસી
New Jersey 州Phil Murphy，州長 | Tahesha Way，副州長公眾服務部Sarah Adelman，部長面向 60 歲以上老年人的 SNAP 食物援助情況說明藉助 SNAP 提高您的雜貨預算！請務必知悉，SNAP 家庭包含家中任何同吃同住的人，但年長者即使與他人同住，亦可單獨申請。對於大多數申請人來說，家庭月收入不得高於下表所示金額。但如果其中某位家庭成員年滿 60 歲或為殘障人士，即使家庭總收入超過對應金額，也仍可能符合資格。如果您的收入固定不變，那麼額外的食物購物金將大有幫助！在 New Jersey，如果您符合資格，每月就可獲得至少 $95 的 SNAP 福利，即每年可額外獲得 $1,140 的食物購物金！如果您有自付的醫療費用、住房和公用事業費，您的福利金額將會更高。立即向您所在縣的社會服務委員會申請 SNAP，或瀏覽 NJSNAP.gov 並轉至「GET SNAP」尋找一位 SNAP 指導員。家庭人口數 - 每月總收入（2023 年 10 月 - 2024 年 9 月）1 $2,2482 $3,041每增加一個成員 增加 $793如果您需要幫助，請前往您所在縣的社會服務委員會或瀏覽 NJSNAP.gov 並轉至「GET SNAP」尋找一位 SNAP 指導員，以幫助您申請。面向老年人的 SNAP 情況說明對任何年滿 60 歲的人士，無工作要求您的資格可以保持 24 個月，之後需重新申請無需親自去申請或完成申請流程 -透過電話或線上即可完成所有流程
New Jersey 주Phil Murphy, 주지사 | Sheila Oliver, 부지사복지부Sarah Adelman, 장관긴급 SNAP 추가 혜택이 2023년 2월에 종료됩니다최근의 연방법 변경으로 인해 SNAP 긴급 배당으로서 여러분께서받으셨던 추가 임시 혜택이 종료될 예정입니다. 따라서 2023년 3월 1일부터는 정규 SNAP 혜택을 받으시게 됩니다. New Jersey 주에서 최소 월SNAP 혜택은 이제 $95입니다.내 혜택 상세를 어디에서 확인할 수 있나요?정규 혜택 및 EA 추가 혜택은 별도로 구분됩니다.귀하께서 계속하여 SNAP 수혜 자격을 유지하시는 경우3월부터 정규 혜택만 받으시게 됩니다. 2월에 정규 혜택금액을 알리는 서신을 우편으로 받으시게 됩니다. 또는다음 방법으로도 자세한 사항을 확인하실 수 있습니다.• ConnectEBT 모바일 앱에 로그인• 온라인에서 www.njfamiliesfirst.com 방문• EBT Families First 카드 뒷면에 기재된 번호1-800-997-3333번으로 전화식료품 지원 리소스와관련하여 도움이필요하십니까?귀하의 우편번호를 문자로귀하의 우편번호를 문자로898-211번에 보내십시오번에 보내십시오식료품 리소스를 온라인식료품 리소스를 온라인nj211.org/njsnap에서 확인하십시오에서 확인하십시오New Jersey지역의 사회복지위원회로 연락하십시오NJSNAP.gov를방문하세요궁금한 점이있습니까?SNAP 식료품 지원 혜택을 받고 계신 분은 확인하십시오중요 업데이트중요 업데이트2월

New JerseyPhil Murphy 州长 | Sheila Oliver 副州长公众服务部Sarah Adelman 部长补充营养援助计划 (SNAP) 紧急补充福利将于2023 年 2 月结束由于联邦法律最近的一项变更，您获得的临时补充福利（即 SNAP 紧急拨款）即将结束。这意味着自 2023 年 3 月 1 日起，您将获得的是SNAP 常规福利。New Jersey目前的 SNAP 福利每月最低为 $95。我可以在哪里查看我的福利详情？常规福利和紧急拨款 (EA) 补充福利将分别列出。如果您仍然有资格获取 SNAP，则从 3 月份开始，您将只能获取常规福利。您会在 2 月份通过邮件收到一封信函，其中会写明您的常规福利金额，或者您可以：• 登录 ConnectEBT 移动应用程序• 登录网址 www.njfamiliesfirst.com• 拨打您电子福利转账卡 EBT Families First 卡片背面的电话号码 - 1-800-997-3333需要食品援助资源方面的帮助？编辑短信发送您的邮政编码至898-211登录网址nj211.org/njsnap查看食品资源New Jersey联系您当地的社会服务委员会访问 NJSNAP.gov有疑问吗？关于 SNAP 食品援助福利重要信息更新重要信息更新二月
New Jersey’s
New Jersey’s Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, SNAP, provides food assistance to families with low incomes to help them buy groceries through a benefits card accepted in most food retail stores and some farmers markets. Eligibility is set by several factors, such as income and resources. You can use your SNAP benefits to stretch your food budget and buy nutritious foods that can keep you and your family healthy.
New employment within 10 days of the date that they receive their first pay

NÃO ESCREVA NOS ESPAÇOS SOMBREADOS
NÒT: Soumisyon nimewo Sekirite Sosyal (SSN) pou tout moun kap viv nan fwaye an gen otorizasyon anba lwa Food Stamp Act 1977
NÒT: Soumisyon nimewo Sekirite Sosyal (SSN) pou tout moun kap viv nan fwaye an gen otorizasyon anba lwa Food Stamp Act 1977lan, selon amandman an, 7 U.SC. 2011-2036; Lwa Piblik 104-193 egzije soumisyon tout SSN pou tout moun ki fè aplikasyon pouWFJN. Nimewo SSN ou an pral sèvi pou detèmine si fwaye ou an elijib oubyen pral kontinye elijib pou patisipe nan Pwogam NJSNAP lan epi/oubyen pwogram WFNJ an. Nou pral verifye enfòmasyon sa travè pwogram entèkoneksyon òdinatè. Enfòmasyon saa pral sèvi tou pou kontwol konfòmite avèk règleman pwogram lan epi sou jestyon pwogram lan. Enfòmasyon sa a kapab divilgebay lòt ajans Federal epi Etatik pou analiz ofisyèl, epi bay ofisyèl nan travay lapolis pou kapab apreyande moun kap sove pou evitepwoblèm nan lajistis. Si yon reklamasyon NJ SNAP vin depoze kont oumenm, enfòmasyon ki nan aplikasyon sa a, tankou tout SSN,kapab sèvi kòm referans pou ajans Federal avèdk Etatik, epitou ajans prive ki rekouvre dèt, pou aksyon reklamasyon. Se de pwòpvolonte yo moun kap fè aplikasyon yo bay enfòmasyon yo, tankou SSN chak moun kap viv nan fwaye an, jan sa ki egzije an.Sepandan, lè moun pa bay enfòmasyon sa a, sa pral gen kòm konsekans refi demand pou benefis NJ SNAP epi/oubyen benefisWFNJ yo bay fwaye ou.
Não há necessidade de ir pessoalmente

O CHARAKTERZE OGÓLNYM
O NJ SNAP
O benefício regular e o benefício extra EA são listados
O fornecimento das informações solicitadas, incluindo o Número de Seguro Social de cada membro do agregado
O lugar onde mora de facto:
O seu
OBSERVAÇÃO:
OBSERVAÇÃO: A apresentação dos Números do Seguro Social (Social Security) referentes a todos os membros do agregadofamiliar é autorizada ao abrigo da Lei de Assistência Alimentar, de 1977, na redacção em vigor, 7 U.S.C. 2011-2036; A Lei Pública104-193 exige a apresentação dos Número de Seguro Social de todos os indivíduos fazendo o requerimento para o WFNJ. O seuNúmero de Seguro Social será usado para determinar se o seu agregado familiar está apto ou continua a estar apto a participar doPrograma NJ SNAP e/ou do programa WFNJ. Iremos apurar estas informações através de programas de concordância de dadosinformáticos. Estas informações também serão usadas para monitorar a conformidade com os regulamentos do programa e para agestão do programa. Essas informações podem ser divulgadas a outras agências Federais e Estaduais para averiguações oficiais,assim como para os agentes da lei com a finalidade de apreender fugitivos da lei. Se for feita uma alegação do NJ SNAP contra oseu agregado familiar, as informações deste requerimento, incluindo todos os Números de Seguro Social, poderão serencaminhadas para as agências Federais e Estaduais, bem como às agências de cobrança de créditos privados, para acções dereivindicação. O fornecimento das informações solicitadas, incluindo o Número de Seguro Social de cada membro do agregadofamiliar, é voluntário, para fins do NJ SNAP. No entanto, deixar de fornecer estas informações resultará na rejeição dos subsídiosNJ SNAP e/ou dos subsídios WFNJ ao seu agregado familiar.
ODPOWIEDZI,

On
On MyNJHelps you can see your:
On-the-job training;
Once installed, you will need to verify your identity and then you will be able to log in or create a new account.  The user name and password is the same as your online account at NJFamiliesFirst.com, if you already have an account. If you create a new account on the app, your user name and password will also work at NJFamiliesFirst.com.
Once you have a MyNJHelps account, you will be able to start an application and submit it or save it to finish later. You will also be able to upload supporting documents and check the status of your submitted application.
Once you have been approved for SNAP there are some things you need to do to stay on SNAP.  Your SNAP case was granted for a limited amount of time, which we call a certification period.  Most people are certified for either 12 or 24 months. You must complete an Interim Reporting Form (IRF) halfway through your certification period if you want to continue benefits. Two months before your certification period expires, you will be sent a letter that it is time to recertify. You will need to complete a recertification if you want to continue to receive SNAP benefits.
Onde ocorreu a fraude
One Stop Career Center
One Stop Career Center de New Jersey.
One parent can claim one child under the age of 6. If you have other children under 6, the other parent can claim that child/children for college student eligibility. If you only have one child under the age of 6, the other parent may still be eligible if they meet one of the other college student eligibility requirements listed above.

P-EBT
P-EBT Benefit Search
P-EBT Benefit Search \n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe P-EBT Benefit Search page allows you to search for any student information that was submitted by schools for any P-EBT benefit period after June 17, 2021 and was issued a P-EBT benefit by the NJ Department of Human Services. This information can help you check if your school-age child was issued P-EBT benefits for a particular time period.\nHow do I get to the P-EBT Benefits Search page?\nClick here to visit the P-EBT Benefits Search page.
P-EBT Benefit Search page
P-EBT Benefit SearchVisit the P-EBT Benefit Search Pageor Email P-EBT
P-EBT benefits were issued on a P-EBT card or added to the Families First EBT card for children identified to a SNAP case.  To check the balance of your P-EBT/Families First Card:
P-EBT eligibility for school-age children varied depending on the school year.
P-EBT was in effect for eligible students during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021, 2022, and 2023.  P-EBT was in effect for children under 6 in SNAP households during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021 and 2022 for the months they received SNAP.

POU ITILIZASYON BIWO AN SÈLMAN
POU ITILIZASYON BIWO AN SÈLMANAdrès kote ou resevwa lapòst si li pa menm avèk adrès kay kote ou rete ki make anwo an.6.Ou kapab bay yon oubyen plis pase yon moun otorizasyon pou fè aplikasyon pou pwogram NJ SNAP oubyen GA nan non ou, pou ou kapab resevwa benefis NJ SNAP oubyen, oubyen benefis GA, oubyen pou itilize benefis NJ SNAP pou achte manje pou ou.   Si ou elijib pou resevwa benefis NJ SNAP, moun ou deziyen anpral resevwa yon kat FAMILIES FIRST EBT li kapab itilize pou achte manje ou.   Si ou vle deziyen yon moun konsa, makeenfòmasyon sa yo:Non moun ki otorize an   Dat                       SSN  TelefònReprezantan      Nesans   Adrès    (Fakiltatif) NimewoKESTYON 7 avèk 8 KI ANBA YO - POU MOUN KAP FÈ APLIKASYON NJ SNAP YO SÈLMANPOU ITILIZASYON BIWO AN SÈLMANELIJIBILITE KATEKORIK :Moun kap fè aplikasyon anLòt moun kap fè aplikasyonPou moun kap fè aplikasyon anKalite asistansKote fwod lan te fèt Ki benefisMoun ki komèt ofans lan Moun kap resevwa tretman anSIYATIÈDTAN PA SEMÈNCHAK KONBYEN TAN YO PEYENON TIMOUN/GRANMOUN LANBAY KIYÈSAsirans Chomaj Sous revniAne/MakMONTAN KI PEYE ANCHAK KONBYEN TAN BIL LAN SOTISOU-TOTAL LOJMAN LwilDAT SELEKSYON OPSYON SA AWFNJ-1J (Rev. 10/14) Paj 12 sou 12SI OU PA RAPÒTE OUBYEN VERIFYE NENPÒT NAN DEPANS KI PI BA LA A, SWA KE OUMENM OUBYEN YON LÒT MOUN KAP VIV NAN FWAYE AN AP PEYE, NOU PRAL WÈ SA KÒM SI OU PA VLE RESEVWA YON DEDIKSYON REVNI POU MOUN KI GEN DEPANS KI PAT RAPÒTE.MENM SI OU PA DI NOU (OUBYEN VERIFYE) WAP FÈ YOUN NAN DEPANS SA YO LÈ OU FÈ APLIKASYON POU PWOGRAM NJ SNAP LAN, OU KAPAB KAN MENM RESEVWA YON DEDIKSYON REVNI PI TA SI OU DI NOU (OUBYEN VERIFYE) WAP PEYE YOUN NAN DEPANS SA YO. POU pwogram NJ SNAP lan

PRECISA DE AJUDA
PREGUNTAS 12 Y 13 A CONTINUACIÓN: SOLO PARA LOS SOLICITANTES DE NJ SNAP
PREGUNTAS 12 Y 13 A CONTINUACIÓN: SOLO PARA LOS SOLICITANTES DE NJ SNAPSI NO INFORMA O VERIFICA NINGUNO DE LOS SIGUIENTES GASTOS QUE PAGAN USTED O ALGUNO DE LOS MIEMBROS DEL HOGAR, CONSIDERAREMOS QUE USTED NO DESEA RECIBIR UNA DEDUCCIÓN DE INGRESOS PARA ESOS GASTOS NO INFORMADOS.

PWOGRAM NJ SNAP

Pakont, si manm fwaye a gen 60 lane oswa depase
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) was a temporary program to help purchase food for school-age children who were eligible for free or reduced price school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) and temporarily lost access to school meals due to COVID-19 pandemic-related school closures or reduced attendance.  P-EBT was discontinued with the end of the Public Health Emergency effective May 11, 2023.
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) was a temporary program to help purchase food for school-age children who were eligible for free or reduced price school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) and temporarily lost access to school meals due to COVID-19 pandemic-related school closures or reduced attendance.  P-EBT was discontinued with the end of the Public Health Emergency effective May 11, 2023.\nP-EBT was in effect for eligible students during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021, 2022, and 2023.  P-EBT was in effect for children under 6 in SNAP households during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021 and 2022 for the months they received SNAP.\nTo have received P-EBT benefits for summer 2021, 2022, and/or 2023 school-age children must have been:\n\nEligible for free or reduced-price school meals under National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) as a student in grades K-12 in the school year leading up to summer, or\nDetermined newly eligible for free or reduced-price school meals during the covered summer period (not including incoming Kindergarten students) following the school year; or,\nAttending a school that participated in the Community Eligibility Provision.\n\nP-EBT eligibility for school-age children varied depending on the school year.
Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT)
Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT) Program History
Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT) Program History \n\n\n\n\n\n\nPandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) was a temporary program to help purchase food for school-age children who were eligible for free or reduced price school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) and temporarily lost access to school meals due to COVID-19 pandemic-related school closures or reduced attendance.  P-EBT was discontinued with the end of the Public Health Emergency effective May 11, 2023.\nP-EBT was in effect for eligible students during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021, 2022, and 2023.  P-EBT was in effect for children under 6 in SNAP households during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021 and 2022 for the months they received SNAP.\nTo have received P-EBT benefits for summer 2021, 2022, and/or 2023 school-age children must have been:\n\nEligible for free or reduced-price school meals under National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) as a student in grades K-12 in the school year leading up to summer, or\nDetermined newly eligible for free or reduced-price school meals during the covered summer period (not including incoming Kindergarten students) following the school year; or,\nAttending a school that participated in the Community Eligibility Provision.\n\nP-EBT eligibility for school-age children varied depending on the school year.
Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT) Program History \n\n\n\n\n\n\nPandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) was a temporary program to help purchase food for school-age children who were eligible for free or reduced price school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) and temporarily lost access to school meals due to COVID-19 pandemic-related school closures or reduced attendance.  P-EBT was discontinued with the end of the Public Health Emergency effective May 11, 2023.\nP-EBT was in effect for eligible students during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021, 2022, and 2023.  P-EBT was in effect for children under 6 in SNAP households during school years 2020-2023, and Summer 2021 and 2022 for the months they received SNAP.\nTo have received P-EBT benefits for summer 2021, 2022, and/or 2023 school-age children must have been:\n\nEligible for free or reduced-price school meals under National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or School Breakfast Program (SBP) as a student in grades K-12 in the school year leading up to summer, or\nDetermined newly eligible for free or reduced-price school meals during the covered summer period (not including incoming Kindergarten students) following the school year; or,\nAttending a school that participated in the Community Eligibility Provision.\n\nP-EBT eligibility for school-age children varied depending on the school year.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\tUsing Your P-EBT Card \n\n\n\n\n\n\nChecking Your Balance\nP-EBT benefits were issued on a P-EBT card or added to the Families First EBT card for children identified to a SNAP case.  To check the balance of your P-EBT/Families First Card:\n\nGo to NJFamiliesFirst.com or download the ConnectEBT app in the Apple App store or Google Play store to create an account to view your current card balance and transaction history; or,\nCall EBT Customer Service at 1-800-997-3333 to use the automated phone system to get your balance; or,\nCheck your last store receipt.\n\nProtection and Security of P-EBT Card and Benefits\n\nDon’t share your PIN with anyone.\nDo not write your PIN on your card or card holder. Also, do not carry the number with you in your purse or wallet.\nIf you cannot find your card or if you think someone knows your PIN, immediately call 1-800-997-3333.\nKeep your card away from electronic equipment (TVs and microwaves), magnets, and out of the sun.\n\nReplacement of P-EBT/Families First EBT Cards\nIf you need to replace your P-EBT card or did not receive your P-EBT card because your address was incorrect, contact your local County Social Service Agency. If your P-EBT card has been lost, stolen or damaged, it is important to immediately report it online at www.NJFamiliesFirst.com or by calling 1-800-997-3333. This will “freeze” your card so no one can use your benefits. After reporting it, contact your local County Social Service Agency for a replacement P-EBT card. You may be asked to verify your identity. There may be a fee for replacement P-EBT cards.\nStolen or Fraudulently Used Benefits\nFederal regulations do not allow for the replacement of stolen P-EBT benefits.  If you suspect your PIN was stolen, you can call 1-800-997-3333, go to www.NJFamiliesFirst.com or download the Connect EBT app in the Apple App store or Google Play store to review your transactions and/or change your PIN to protect any remaining benefits.\nExpunged Benefits\nIf you have not used any of your P-EBT benefits for nine months from the date your benefit was issued or the last transaction, your old benefits will be expunged, meaning removed from your card. For example, as long as you are using your card at least once every nine months, your benefits will remain active.  Federal regulations do not allow benefits to be replaced after they have been expunged.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\tP-EBT Benefit Search \n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe P-EBT Benefit Search page allows you to search for any student information that was submitted by schools for any P-EBT benefit period after June 17, 2021 and was issued a P-EBT benefit by the NJ Department of Human Services. This information can help you check if your school-age child was issued P-EBT benefits for a particular time period.\nHow do I get to the P-EBT Benefits Search page?\nClick here to visit the P-EBT Benefits Search page.\n\n\n\n\nIf your question was not answered in any of the FAQs above, see the chart below to find who to contact for more information.\n\n\n\n\nI HAVE QUESTIONS ABOUT:\n\n\nWHO DO I CONTACT?\n\n\n\n\n\nActivating my card\nMy P-EBT or Summer EBT Balance\nChanging my PIN\nReporting a lost, stolen or damaged card\n\n\n\nEBT Card Customer ServiceCall 1-800-997-3333 or visitEBT Connect Client Portal\n\n\n\n\n\nMy child(ren)'s attendance status used to determine the P-EBT benefit amount\nThe address where my card was mailed\nThe date of birth listed for my child(ren)\n\n\n\nCall your child(ren)'s school\n\n\n\n\n\nMy 2024 Summer EBT benefits\n\n\n\nSummer EBT Hotline1-833-670-7328 \n\n\n\n\n\nMy P-EBT benefits and case status\n\n\n\nP-EBT Benefit SearchVisit the P-EBT Benefit Search Pageor Email P-EBT\n\n\n\n\n\nA replacement P-EBT card (There may be a fee to replace.)\n\n\n\nCounty Social Service AgencyFind your county's contact information here\n\n\n\n\nUpdated 6/6/24
Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT)\n\t\t\t\t\n\nSummer EBT\nNJ Summer EBT is a child nutrition program intended to reduce hunger and food insecurity for children who lose access to free school meals through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) and School Breakfast Program (SBP) during the summer when school is not in session. For more information on the new Summer EBT program, go to www.nj.gov/summerebt.\nImportant Summer EBT information!\n\nSummer EBT benefits are separate and apart from any Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits.\nSummer EBT benefits will be issued on a separate \

Pharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged & Disabled (PAAD)The Pharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged and Disabled (PAAD) program is a state-funded program that helps eligible seniors and individuals with disabilities save money on their prescription drug costs.
